intro: Anuragia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers, which are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant is native to regions of southern and eastern Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea. Anuragia species are often found in woodland areas and rocky habitats, thriving in partial shade. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while the stems are often branched and upright.
